intro: Trichoceros dombeyi, commonly known as the Dombey's featherbloom, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
